prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the key pieces of evidence and the testimonies provided.

First, the evidence: There's a lot here, but I'll focus on the ones that seem important. The **Crystal Sphere** was found near Dusky Bridge with blood on it. That suggests it was used in the murder. Then there's the **Shichishito**, which is described as the apparent murder weapon but isn't the actual one. The **Victim's Staff** has a hidden sword inside, which is likely the real weapon used to kill Elise. The **Weather Data** shows that it was snowing and lightning struck the bridge around the time of the murder, which matches the timeline of the crime.

Now, looking at the testimonies. **Iris** says she saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff and then move in to deliver a fatal strike. She also mentions that Elise threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe. This implies that Elise used both the staff and a dagger in the murder.

But wait, the **Crystal Sphere** was found near the bridge with blood, and the **Shichishito** was covered in blood and fingerprints. If Elise used the dagger, why is the Crystal Sphere covered in blood? It doesn't add up. Also, the **Shichishito** being a seven-branched sword doesn't fit with the description of the dagger Iris mentioned.

Another point is the **Staff** being the actual weapon. If the staff was used to stab Elise, why is there a dagger involved? It seems like there's a mix-up here. The testimony suggests Elise used the dagger, but the evidence points to the staff or the Crystal Sphere being the murder weapon.

Also, the **Burnt Letter** from Morgan Fey was found in the incinerator. It's unclear how this ties in, but it might indicate some sort of plan or instruction related to the crime.

Putting this together, the **Crystal Sphere** and the **Shichishito** both have blood on them, but the testimony says Elise used a dagger. This inconsistency suggests that the testimony might be misleading or that the evidence doesn't align with the account given by Iris. Therefore, the **Crystal Sphere** and the **Testimony of Iris** contradict each other because the evidence suggests the Sphere was used, but the testimony points to a dagger.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's try to figure this out. I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. I need to find a pair where evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters are from a game, I think, based on the names and descriptions.

First, I'll look at the testimonies and see what they're saying. Testimony 0 says that Mystic Maya stumbled after being hit with a staff. Testimony 1 says she then stole the weapon. Testimony 2 says Mystic Elise was on the defensive with her back to a lantern. Testimony 3 says Maya stabbed Elise. Testimony 4 says Elise managed to fling the knife away but then collapsed.

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 9 is about the victim's staff, which has fingerprints and a hidden sword. Evidence 10 is the Shichishito, the apparent murder weapon with blood and fingerprints, but it's not the actual weapon. Evidence 11 is Elise's autopsy, showing she died from a stab wound.

So, Testimony 3 says Maya stabbed Elise, but the evidence shows that the Shichishito was used, not the staff. There's also a Crystal Sphere found with blood, which might be the real murder weapon. So, the testimony and evidence contradict because the testimony points to Maya using the staff, while the evidence shows the Shichishito was the weapon.

I think the pair that contradicts is Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff) and Testimony 3 (Maya stabbed Elise). The testimony suggests Maya used the staff, but the evidence shows the Shichishito was the actual weapon.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the testimonies and the evidence provided. 

First, the testimonies mention that Iris saw the murder at around 11 PM and that she was the one who removed the body from the scene. She claims that she dragged it across Dusky Bridge and used a snowmobile to bring it back to Hazakura Temple. She also says that she used the Shichishito, the murder weapon, to alter the wound to make it look different.

Now, looking at the evidence, the Shichishito was found with the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints, but it's stated that it's not the actual murder weapon. Additionally, the Crystal Sphere was found near Dusky Bridge with blood on it, which came from the victim's staff. However, the Dagger, which was used to commit the murder, was found in the Inner Temple garden, and its blood doesn't match the victim's. This suggests that the Dagger might be the actual murder weapon.

So, the testimony says that Iris used the Shichishito to alter the wound, but the evidence indicates that the Dagger was the weapon used. This is a contradiction because if the Shichishito wasn't the murder weapon, then Iris's claim about using it doesn't align with the evidence.

Therefore, the evidence (Shichishito) and the testimony (Iris's account) contradict each other.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony are contradicting each other in this case. I'm not very familiar with all the details, but I'll take it step by step.

First, I need to understand the context. It seems like there's a murder involving Elise Deauxnim, also known as Mystic Elise. She was an author and illustrator, and her death seems to be connected to some kind of ritual or event at Hazakura Temple. There are several characters involved, including Phoenix Wright, Dick Gumshoe, and others, each with their own roles and testimonies.

Looking at the evidences, there's a lot of information about the crime scene, the victim, and the suspect. For example, the **Crime Photo** (Evidence 13) shows the courtyard where Elise was murdered. The **Tracks Photo** (Evidence 14) shows a track leading from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. The **Larry's Sketch** (Evidence 15) describes a bridge on fire with a silhouette gliding over it. The **Crystal Sphere** (Evidence 16) was found near Dusky Bridge with blood on it, suggesting it might be connected to the murder weapon.

Now, looking at the testimonies, **Testimony 5** from Iris says, "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." This is important because the weather data (Evidence 7) shows that snow started around 7 PM and continued until about 10:50 PM, with lightning striking Dusky Bridge at 10:45. If the snow had already stopped by the time of the murder, that would mean the murder occurred after the snow stopped, but the weather data suggests the snow was still falling during the time of the crime.

So, the **Tracks Photo** and **Larry's Sketch** both mention a bridge on fire and a track leading to Dusky Bridge. This supports the idea that the crime happened around Dusky Bridge. However, if the snow had stopped by the time of the murder, the track leading to Dusky Bridge wouldn't be covered in snow, which contradicts the **Weather Data** that shows snow was still falling during the time of the crime.

Therefore, the **Tracks Photo** and **Weather Data** (along with **Testimony 5**) contradict each other because they provide conflicting information about the time of the crime relative to the weather conditions.

Additionally, the **Crystal Sphere** being found near Dusky Bridge with blood on it suggests that the murder weapon (the Shichishito) was used there, but if the snow was still falling, the blood on the crystal sphere would likely be mixed with snow, which isn't mentioned in the evidence. This further supports the contradiction.

In conclusion, the key pair that contradicts is the **Tracks Photo** (Evidence 14), **Weather Data** (Evidence 7), and **Testimony 5** from Iris. The tracks imply the crime happened during the snowstorm, while Iris's testimony and the weather data suggest the snow had stopped by the time of the murder, creating a contradiction.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I've been given this complex scenario with a bunch of characters, evidences, and testimonies. It's set in a world with magic and law enforcement, which is a bit unusual, but I'll try to make sense of it.

First, I need to figure out what the question is asking. It says, "Which evidence and testimony contradict each other?" and then gives a bunch of information about characters, evidences, and testimonies. My task is to identify one pair where evidence contradicts testimony and present it in a JSON format.

Okay, let's start by understanding the components:

**Characters:**
- Maya Fey: My assistant in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
- Mia Fey: Maya's older sister, a mentor who passed away.
- Godot: A mysterious prosecutor who seems to know me.
- Pearl Fey: Maya's cousin, a powerful spiritualist.
- Bikini: A nun at Hazakura Temple.
- Elise Deauxnim: An author and illustrator, a fan of Maya's.
- Iris: A nun at Hazakura Temple, reminiscent of someone else.
- Laurice Deauxnim (Larry Butz): In training as Elise's pupil.
- Phoenix Wright: My friend who fell from Dusky Bridge.
- Dick Gumshoe: A homicide detective.
- Franziska von Karma: My mentor from Germany.
- Miles Edgeworth: An old friend studying foreign judicial systems.
- Morgan Fey: Sister of Misty Fey, mother of Pearl and Iris, in solitary confinement.
- Dahlia Hawthorne: Morgan's daughter, twin sister of Iris.

**Evidences:**
There are 21 pieces of evidence listed, each with a description. They include things like an Attorney's Badge, a Magatama, a Weather Data report, various photos, a Crystal Sphere, etc.

**Testimonies:**
There are 6 testimonies, each from different characters, discussing what they saw or know about the incident.

The goal is to find a contradiction between one piece of evidence and one testimony. The user wants the answer in a JSON format, strictly ending with that line.

Now, to approach this, I'll need to go through each testimony and see if it contradicts any of the evidence. Let's take it step by step.

Starting with Testimony 0 from Maya:
- Maya says she was on the Training Hall floor when she came to, implying she was there before the incident.
- The evidence mentions the Stone Lantern, which was not lit the night of the crime.

If Maya was in the garden when the crime happened, but the Stone Lantern wasn't lit, it might suggest she wasn't there when the lantern was used, contradicting her testimony.

Next, Testimony 1 from Maya:
- She claims the killer cleaned up evidence, but the Crystal Sphere was found with blood, which contradicts her assumption that everything was cleaned up.

However, Testimony 5 from Maya says she assumed the killer was a man, but the Dagger's blood doesn't match the victim's, suggesting it might have been a woman, which would contradict her assumption.

But since the user wants one pair, I'll go with Testimony 1 and Evidence 16 (Crystal Sphere with blood).

So, the evidence (Crystal Sphere with blood) contradicts Maya's testimony that the killer cleaned up all evidence.
</think>

cot:
Alright, I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the testimonies and the corresponding evidence.

First, Testimony 0 says that Pearl was also stuck on the Inner Temple side that night. But from the evidence, the Crystal Sphere was found near Dusky Bridge, which is on the other side of the bridge. This suggests that Pearl wasn't there that night, which contradicts Testimony 0.

Next, Testimony 1 mentions that the next morning, Pearl couldn't find anyone. However, Evidence 21 shows a photo taken after the crime, which implies that someone was there. This contradiction suggests that Pearl wasn't alone, which conflicts with her testimony.

Finally, Testimony 2 indicates that Pearl was in the spare prep room the next day when Godot arrived. But Evidence 20 mentions the Stone Lantern, which wasn't lit, implying Pearl wasn't there. This further supports that Pearl wasn't present as claimed.

Putting it all together, the evidence about the Crystal Sphere and the Stone Lantern contradict Pearl's testimonies, indicating she wasn't where she said she was.
</think>
